instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fans High
threads.message:
Hi.
Passes ASD EFI but fans run high at times when performing what should be effortless tasks. i.e. copying 6 gigs of data from and external HDD. 
reapplied thermal grease.
There are small signs of liquid below the PCH on both sides. But very minor with no visible corrosion in scope. 
Thanks. Have a good one.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fans High
threads.message: Try another fan, but if no errors on ASD  what is the problem with high speed fan sometimes???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fans High
threads.message: Thanks aprendiz for response. Will do. It just seemed odd that it would spike from a data transfer. Thanks again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fans High
threads.message: <RESISTOR>R5665</RESISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R5660</RESISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R5661</RESISTOR>/<TRANSISTOR>Q5660</TRANSISTOR> would be suspect to me. I have had one machine where <TRANSISTOR>Q5660</TRANSISTOR> issue caused fan to spin fast constantly.
